com.craftfire.commons.ip
Class IPv4Address

java.lang.Object
  com.craftfire.commons.ip.IPAddress
      com.craftfire.commons.ip.IPv4Address

public class IPv4Address
extends IPAddress

A class that represents an IPv4 address.

Constructor Summary

          Creates an IPv4Address object form given byte representation.

          Creates an IPv4Address object for given Inet4Address.
IPv4Address(int... address)
          Creates an IPv4Address object from four integers corresponding to four parts of IPv4 address (usually seperated by dots).

public IPv4Address(Inet4Address address)
Creates an IPv4Address object for given Inet4Address.

Parameters:

See Also:
IPAddress.valueOf(InetAddress)

IPv4Address

public IPv4Address(byte... address)
Creates an IPv4Address object form given byte representation.

Parameters:
address - byte representation of the IPv4 address, must be 4 byte long
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the number of bytes is different than 4

IPv4Address

public IPv4Address(int... address)
Creates an IPv4Address object from four integers corresponding to four parts of IPv4 address (usually seperated by dots).

Parameters:
address - integer parts of the IPv4 address, must be exactly 4 elements
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the number of ints is different than 4

getAddress

public byte[] getAddress()
Returns four bytes, one for each part of IPv4 address (usually separated by dots).

In this case it returns the same value as getBytes()

Returns:
four bytes, one for each part of IPv4 address

getInt

public int getInt()
Returns the value of this address in single integer, which contains four bytes of the address.

Returns:
single integer representation of this address
